intro: Columnea ericae var. ericae, commonly known as the Erica Columnea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces bright red or orange flowers that attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Columnea ericae var. ericae is often cultivated as a decorative plant in greenhouses and shaded gardens.
